meanings.definition: Tear or make deep cuts in (flesh or skin)
meanings.sent1: The sharp rock can lacerate your hand if you touch it.
meanings.sent2: The knife accidentally lacerated the chef's finger while he was cutting vegetables.
meanings.sent3: Be careful with that broken glass, it can lacerate you and ruin your day.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to lacerate his heart, leaving him feeling wounded and vulnerable.
meanings.sent5: The image of the lion's claws ready to lacerate its prey was both terrifying and fascinating.

meanings.sent1: Seeing his pet in pain lacerated the boy's heart.
meanings.sent2: The loss of her favorite toy lacerated the little girl's emotions.
meanings.sent3: The loud noise from the party next door continued to lacerate his ears.
meanings.sent4: The constant criticism seemed to lacerate her self-esteem, making her doubt her worth.
meanings.sent5: The haunting melody of the song lacerated his soul, bringing back memories of lost love.
